documentation.description: This is an internal mapping that indicates the source field and target field relationship, there are value pairs separated by semicolon, each pair starting with point followed by slash followed by the relative path to the source field in the source table, then an equals sign followed by the relative path within the corresponding target field in the target table (no blank spaces should be specified, nor before nor after the equals sign) example: ./Source/Path/Field1=Target/Path/Field1;./Source/Path/Field1=Path/To/Target/Field2

documentation.label: Fetch Size
documentation.description: This is the amount of records to read and keep in memory at a time from the source.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: This is the amount of records to be group together for insertion in the target table.

documentation.label: Created Records
documentation.description: Records Created During the Process.

documentation.label: Updated Records
documentation.description: Records Updated During the Process.

documentation.label: Deleted Records
documentation.description: Records Deleted During the Process.

documentation.label: Invalid Records
documentation.description: Records Invalid During the Process.

documentation.label: Processed Records
documentation.description: Records Processed.

documentation.label: SQL Data Synchronization
documentation.description: This script Exports the data controlling whether there are updates, inserts or deletes regarding a specific table from a parent data space to a child data space and reports the number of records processed.

documentation.label: Parent Data Space
documentation.description: This variable indicates the parent Data Space to use as reference in order to identify insertions, deletions and updates.

documentation.label: Data Space
documentation.description: This data space where tables reside to hold metadata statistics.

documentation.label: Data Set
documentation.description: This is the data set where tables reside to hold metadata statistics.

documentation.label: Source Table - Table Path
documentation.description: Table path to where data will be sourced to the database.

documentation.label: JNDI
documentation.description: JNDI value that identifies the data source to be used for the data export.

documentation.label: Filter
documentation.description: An XPath Filter that records need to meet to be routed to the target. Only records meeting this filter would be applied to the target table.

documentation.label: Filter Parameters
documentation.description: Filter parameter values, in the form: $param1=value;$param2=value2;$param3=value3.

documentation.label: Filter Param Types
documentation.description: The parameter data types in the form: $param1=string;$param2=int;$param3=date. Proper types are: date (yyyy-MM-dd), time (HH:mm:ss.SSS), dateandtime (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS), int, decimal, boolean.

documentation.label: Table Catalog
documentation.description: Table Catalog name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Table Schema
documentation.description: Table Schema name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Table Name
documentation.description: Table name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Creator User Field
documentation.description: Destination field that would keep the user that created the record.

documentation.label: Last User Field
documentation.description: Destination field that would keep the last user that modified the record.

documentation.label: Time of Last Modification Field
documentation.description: Destination field that would keep the time when the record was last modified.

documentation.label: Time of Creation Field
documentation.description: Destination field that would keep the time when the record was created.

documentation.label: Flag Change Field
documentation.description: Destination field that would keep the mark of what happend last to the record "U" -> Update, "C" -> Create, "D" -> Delete. The value must correspond to a field name in the destination table.

documentation.label: Field Mapping
documentation.description: String that indicates the EBX field to Table field mapping. The format is: ./EBX_GROUP/EBX_FIELD=table_field_name;./EBX_FIELD=table_field_name. Each EBX field name must start with: "./", and the complete path within groups are supported, then the table field name after the equals sign, in case where case sensitiveness is needed then the string "true" (without the double quotes) must be specified in "caseSensitive" parameter.

documentation.label: Field Types
documentation.description: String that indicates the target Table Fields Data Type Mapping. The format is: $table_field_name=data_type;$table_field_name_2=data_type. Each table field name must start with a dollar sign. A mapping is terminated by a semicollon or the end of the string. Supported strings for data types are: short, int, long, float, double, bigdecimal, date, time and timestamp, by default, any other data type is presented as String.

documentation.label: Full Refresh
documentation.description: This value must be the string "true" to activate it, other value or left empty means "false". Indicates that all data from the corresponding table would be inserted in the target table, this looses visibility about what changed.

documentation.label: Treat Updates as Inserts
documentation.description: This will indicate to treat record changes as inserts and deletes will not be taken into account, this option is preferred when comining with a previous truncate for systems that do not support record update or deletion.

documentation.label: Case Sensitive
documentation.description: If the value is: true, then the underlying database quote character is used to quote the values specified in the right side of the "Field Mapping" automatically, so they should not be included as part of the name in any case.

documentation.label: Time as Numeric
documentation.description: This indicates if any date, time or timestamp would be converted as a numeric (in milliseconds). If the value is "true" (without double quotes) then the transformation would be applied, any other value would be taken as false and normal data types will apply.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: This indicates the ammount of rows to commit to the source as block before commit.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Number of Updates
documentation.description: The number of updated records.

documentation.label: Number of Deletes
documentation.description: The number of deleted records.

documentation.label: Number of Inserts
documentation.description: The number of inserted records.

documentation.label: Number of Processed Records
documentation.description: The total number of processed records.

documentation.label: SQL Data Deletion
documentation.description: This script Deletes or Truncates the data corresponding to a table referenced possible by catalog, schema and table name.

documentation.label: JNDI
documentation.description: JNDI value that identifies the data source to be used for the data export.

documentation.label: Table Catalog
documentation.description: Table Catalog name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Table Schema
documentation.description: Table Schema name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Table Name
documentation.description: Table name in the destination database.

documentation.label: Case Sensitive
documentation.description: If the value is: true, then the underlying database quote character is used to quote the values specified in the right side of the "Field Mapping" automatically, so they should not be included as part of the name in any case.

documentation.label: Filter
documentation.description: A filter to be applied for deletion. The literal: "truncate" (without double quotes) can be specified to indicate a truncate, if the filter value is left empty, then a truncate is assumed. The expression must be a valid filter expression.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Number of Deletes
documentation.description: The number of deleted records.

documentation.label: Delete EBX Table
documentation.description: This script Deletes an EBX table.

documentation.label: Data Space
documentation.description: The Data Space where the data set that contains the table to be deleted is located.

documentation.label: Data Set
documentation.description: The Data Set where the table to be delete is located.

documentation.label: Table Path
documentation.description: The table path corresponding to the table to be deleted.

documentation.label: XPath Parameters and Values
documentation.description: A string list that must contain each parameter specified in the filter expression and its corresponding value assigned in the following fashion: $param1=value1;$param2=value2;$paramN=valueN.

documentation.label: Filter Parameter Types
documentation.description: This is a list to indicate the types thta correspond to filter fields indicated in the filter expression. The default expression syntax is $param1=value1;$param2=value2;$param3=value3. The values for data types are: date, time, dateandtime, int, decimal, boolean.

documentation.label: Fetch Size
documentation.description: A value to indicate the ammount of records to read and keep in memory before deletion.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Number of Deletes
documentation.description: The number of records deleted.

documentation.label: SQL Execute (No Result Set)
documentation.description: This script executes an SQL statement that does not produce a result set.

documentation.label: JNDI
documentation.description: The JNDI source to use to execute the query.

documentation.label: Query
documentation.description: The Query to be executed.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Query Response
documentation.description: The Response from the Query.

documentation.label: SQL Execute (Result Set to CSV)
documentation.description: This script executes an SQL statement that does produce a result set to keep in a File. The file will be formatted with a separator of ;, delimited by " and escaped by \.

documentation.label: JNDI
documentation.description: The JNDI source to use to execute the query.

documentation.label: Query
documentation.description: The Query to be executed.

documentation.label: Output Directory
documentation.description: A file path to keep the csv output.

documentation.label: Output File Name
documentation.description: (Optional) A file name to assign to the output file.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: A hint to how many records process per internal batch to the file.

documentation.label: Fetch Size
documentation.description: A hint to the underlying data base as per how many records preload to fetch.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Query Response
documentation.description: The Response from the Query.

documentation.label: Source from CSV
documentation.description: This script reads a csv file to an internal EBX table.

documentation.label: Data Space
documentation.description: A data space identifier where the corresponding data set and target table reside.

documentation.label: Data Set
documentation.description: A data set unique name where the target table is.

documentation.label: Table
documentation.description: EBX Table path within data set to load the file contents.

documentation.label: Source File
documentation.description: A path to the source file (within the server) to load.

documentation.label: Delimiter
documentation.description: The delimiter character in the file, the default value is ".

documentation.label: Separator
documentation.description: The separator character in the file, the default value is ;.

documentation.label: Escape
documentation.description: The escape character used within the file, the default value is \.

documentation.label: Charset
documentation.description: A charset name, the default is UTF-8.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: A hint to how many records process per internal batch to the table.

documentation.label: Column Mapping
documentation.description: The headers mapping between the source file and the target EBX table, the source file column names must be specified exactly as they appear written in the file. An example would be the following: $FileColumn1=/EBXTableField1;$FileColumn2=/EBXTableField2. The prefix $ can be escaped if it is part of the file column name by preceding it with a "back slash" character \, after that spaces are supported. For EBX column names, groups are supported and their paths should be specified in the mapping as a relative path starting from the table node (but without point or diagonal), example: $Group1/Group2/FileColumn=EBX_GROUP1/EBX_GROUP2/EBXTaleField, in the source file, diagonals are optional, meaning that a simple column can be mapped to a field inside a group, as long as the target node in EBX does not correpond to a Custom Java Bean.

documentation.label: Date and Time
documentation.description: The specific time format to use for "Date and Time" data type values, the default is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS.

documentation.label: Date Format
documentation.description: The specific date format to use for "Date" data type values, the default is yyyy-MM-dd.

documentation.label: Time Format
documentation.description: The specific time format to use for "Time" data type values, the default is HH:mm:ss.SSS.

documentation.label: Primary Key
documentation.description: A value separated by semicolon (with no blank space) specifying the list of fields conforming the target table primary key.

documentation.label: Messages from process
documentation.description: In this variable are some process messages.

documentation.label: Records Processed
documentation.description: The ammount of records processed.

documentation.label: Check User Sessions
documentation.description: This script executes a periodical check to be aware of user sessions currently active.

documentation.label: CMD Execute
documentation.description: This script executes an OS command.

documentation.label: CMD 1
documentation.description: First part for a command execute, normally sh for linux or cmd.exe for windows.

documentation.label: CMD 2
documentation.description: Second part for a command execute, normally -c for linux or /c for windows.

documentation.label: Command
documentation.description: The command to be executed.

documentation.label: Message from execution
documentation.description: In this variable are found general process messages.

documentation.label: Error messages
documentation.description: In this variable are found error messages.

documentation.label: Response code
documentation.description: In this variable is the response code.

documentation.label: Populate proxy table with proxy values
documentation.description: Populate proxy table with proxy values to represent the percentage to be displayed in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Llena tabla proxy con valores proxy
documentation.description: Llena una tabla proxy con valores proxy para representar el porcentaje a ser mostrado en un "dashboard".

documentation.label: Llena tabla proxy con valores proxy
documentation.description: Llena una tabla proxy con valores proxy para representar el porcentaje a ser mostrado en un cuadro de mandos.

documentation.label: Data Space Proxy Table
documentation.description: Data Space where proxy table resides.

documentation.label: Data Set Proxy Table
documentation.description: Data Set where proxy table resides.

documentation.label: Proxy Table Path
documentation.description: The proxy table path to populate with proxy values to represent the desired percentage to show.

documentation.label: Data Space Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the Data Space that contains the summary table to read data from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Data Set Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the Data Set that contains the summary table to read data from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the summary table that contains the data to read from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: "Data Rule" field name
documentation.description: This is the field name within the Summary Table that contains the data rule value to be used as filter to get the statistics information to write proxy values within the proxy table.

documentation.label: Data Rule
documentation.description: This is the Data Rule value to be filtered out from the Summary Table to retrieve the statistics information to write proxy values into the proxy table.

documentation.label: "Succeeded Records" Field Name
documentation.description: This is the field within the Summary Table that reads the value regarding how many records successfully meet the data rule.

documentation.label: "Total Records" field name
documentation.description: This is the field within the Summary Table that reads the value regarding the total records that went through the Data Rule for validation.

documentation.label: "Proxy Value" field name
documentation.description: This is the field name within the Proxy Table that will hold the proxy values to be used to represent the desired percentage.

documentation.label: With Truncate Option
documentation.description: This indicates if deleting all records for the table is needed before filling with proxy values.

documentation.label: Desired Proxy Value
documentation.description: This is the proxy value to be written within the proxy table.

documentation.label: Desired Proxy Complement Value
documentation.description: This is the proxy value to be written within the proxy table as a filler to represent properly the desired percentage.

documentation.label: Remarks
documentation.description: This variable contains observations caught during the proxy filling process.

documentation.label: Populate proxy table with proxy values from single cell value
documentation.description: Populate proxy table with proxy values from a specific field corresponding to precisely the first record of a summary table, to get enough records in a "Proxy Table" in order to represent the percentage to be displayed in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Llena tabla proxy con valores proxy desde una celda
documentation.description: Llena una tabla proxy con valores proxy desde el valor de un campo en el primer registro de una tabla para representar el porcentaje a ser mostrado en un "dashboard". Con esto se quiere decir que, dada una tabla resumen, se piensa que las columnas de la tabla especifiquen el valor total entre 0 y 100 de cada mtrica a representar, de modo que dicha tabla slo requiere de un solo registro que contenga los valores finales de porcentaje.

documentation.label: Llena tabla proxy con valores proxy desde una celda
documentation.description: Llena una tabla proxy con valores proxy desde el valor de un campo en el primer registro de una tabla para representar el porcentaje a ser mostrado en un "dashboard". Con esto se quiere decir que, dada una tabla resumen, se piensa que las columnas de la tabla especifiquen el valor total entre 0 y 100 de cada mtrica a representar, de modo que dicha tabla slo requiere de un solo registro que contenga los valores finales de porcentaje.

documentation.label: Data Space Proxy Table
documentation.description: Data Space where proxy table resides.

documentation.label: Data Set Proxy Table
documentation.description: Data Set where proxy table resides.

documentation.label: Proxy Table Path
documentation.description: The proxy table path to populate with proxy values to represent the desired percentage to show.

documentation.label: Data Space Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the Data Space that contains the summary table to read data from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Data Set Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the Data Set that contains the summary table to read data from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Summary Table
documentation.description: This is the summary table that contains the data to read from to get how many proxy values should be written in the proxy table to represent the desired percentage to be shown in a dashboard.

documentation.label: Subject field name
documentation.description: This is the field name within the Summary Table that contains the total percentage to be represented with proxy values witihn the proxy table. The field name should refer to the desired metric.

documentation.label: "Proxy Value" field name
documentation.description: This is the field name within the Proxy Table that will hold the proxy values to be used to represent the desired percentage.

documentation.label: With Truncate Option
documentation.description: This indicates if deleting all records for the table is needed before filling with proxy values.

documentation.label: Desired Proxy Value
documentation.description: This is the proxy value to be written within the proxy table.

documentation.label: Desired Proxy Complement Value
documentation.description: This is the proxy value to be written within the proxy table as a filler to represent properly the desired percentage.

documentation.label: Remarks
documentation.description: This variable contains observations caught during the proxy filling process.

documentation.label: Make Consistency Comparison
documentation.description: This task makes a consistency data quality dimension comparison between two tables (or result sets) that can be assambled by querying directly through a Data Source Definition (JNDI).

documentation.label: Efectua Comparacin de Consistencia
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo una comparacin de la dimensin de calidad de datos de Consistencia entre dos tablas (o conjuntos de resultado) que puedan ser obtenidos al ejecutar consultas directas a travs de la Definicin de la Fuente de Datos (JNDI).

documentation.label: Efectua Comparacin de Consistencia
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo una comparacin de la dimensin de calidad de datos de Consistencia entre dos tablas (o conjuntos de resultado) que puedan ser obtenidos al ejecutar consultas directas a travs de la Definicin de la Fuente de Datos (JNDI).

documentation.label: Data Source Name
documentation.description: This is the Data Source Name as defined in the Global Naming Resource within the App Server configuration files.

documentation.label: Source Query A
documentation.description: A query to build the A-side result set to be used as the main set. Each record from this set will be matched against the B-side result set to see if there is any record matching the condition logic described by "Comparison Class Name" java class.

documentation.label: Keys A
documentation.description: The A-side (result set) primary keys (separated with comma "," and without blanks).

documentation.label: Source Query B
documentation.description: A query to build the B-side result set to be used as a search result set where each record from the A-side result set will be matched against by using the corresponding Key definitions.

documentation.label: Keys B
documentation.description: The B-side (result set) primary keys (separated with comma "," and without blanks).

documentation.label: Comparison Class Name
documentation.description: A java class name that implements "com.alldatum.ebx.scripts.dc.consistency.OnRecordsMatchComparison" interface containing the comparison logic.

documentation.label: Field Mappings
documentation.description: This specifies pairs of field values (from result set A to result set B) that will be compared as "equals". Pairs are separated with a pipe "|", and value pairs are separated with a comma ",". This is optional.

documentation.label: Is Inverse Count
documentation.description: A boolean value, if true, then the result should be "Number of Non Compliant Records", else "Number of Compliant Records" should be taken into account.

documentation.label: Data Space Details Table
documentation.description: The Data Set containing the table where the details that compound the result are gathered.

documentation.label: Data Set Details Table
documentation.description: The Data Set containing the table where the details that compound the result are gathered.

documentation.label: Details Table
documentation.description: This is the table containing the details in terms of which table is, which key values correspond to the processed table and the result or remarks produced during the comparison process.

documentation.label: Table Name
documentation.description: This is the table name to use to register every record detail for the current comparison process within the details table.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: The batch size tells how many records can be included as batch before commiting. An interval then multiplies this batch size to get the total ammount of records to keep in memory before commiting to the database.

documentation.label: Monitoring Data Space
documentation.description: Data Space where monitoring table is found.

documentation.label: Espacio de Datos de Monitoreo
documentation.description: Espacio de Datos de Monitoreo.

documentation.label: Monitoring Data Set
documentation.description: Data Set where monitoring table is found.

documentation.label: Conjunto de Datos de Monitoreo
documentation.description: Conjunto de datos en el que se encuentra la tabla de monitoreo.

documentation.label: Monitoring Table
documentation.description: Monitoring table. For each batch processed (see Batch Size), the task will update the corresponding record identified by the monitoring table and record parameters (see also Record Primary Key) with internal information to give a status about it's process.

documentation.label: Tabla de Monitoreo
documentation.description: Tabla de Monitoreo. Cada que se cumpla con un intervalo de ejecucin (batch, vase "Tamao de Batch"), se actualizar el registro especificado en la tabla por el valor de llave primaria indicado en el parmetro "Llave Primaria de Registro".

documentation.label: Monitoring Elapsed Time Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the elapsed time for a current processed, the corresponding column data type must be Decimal, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Tiempo Transcurrido
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el tiempo transcurrido, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser Decimal. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote).

documentation.label: Monitoring Processed Records Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the amount of records being processed, the corresponding column data type must be Decimal, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Cantidad de Registros Procesados
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar la cantidad actual de registros procesados, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser Decimal. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote).

documentation.label: Monitoring Last Message Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the last relevant message during the last batch process. The corresponding column data type must be String, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de ltimo Mensaje
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el ltimo mensaje relevante durante el ltimo bloque de registros, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser String. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote).

documentation.label: Monitoring Status Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the process execution status. The corresponding column data type must be String, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Estatus de Monitoreo
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el estatus del progreso de la ejecucin, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser String. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote).

documentation.label: Monitoring Total Records Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the total records to be processed. The corresponding column data type must be Decimal, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Total de Registros
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el total de registros a procesar, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser Decimal. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote).

documentation.label: Monitoring Progress Percentage Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the porcentaje de avance de procesamiento de registros. The corresponding column data type must be String, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Porcentaje de Avance
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el porcentaje de avance de registros procesados, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser Decimal. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote) o cada vez que se cumple el periodo establecido.

documentation.label: Monitoring Process Type Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify the process type. The corresponding column data type must be String, the value is updated each time a batch is commited.

documentation.label: Columna de Tipo de Proceso
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar el nombre del tipo de proceso en ejecucin, el tipo de dato en la tabla de EBX debe ser Decimal. El valor se actualiza cada vez que se procesa un bloque de datos completo (segn el Tamao de Lote) o cada vez que se cumple el periodo establecido.

documentation.label: Monitoring Tag Field
documentation.description: Column name within the monitoring table to specify a tag to have more information about the running process.

documentation.label: Columna de Etiqueta de Monitoreo
documentation.description: Nombre de la columna en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se especificar una etiqueta para identificar con mayor precisin en proceso en ejecucin o que corri.

documentation.label: Primary Key
documentation.description: Monitoring table primary record to write progress information about a running process. If this is not specified, then a new record will be created in the table to be updated with reporting data each time a batch is completed or the period time is reached.

documentation.label: Llave Primaria
documentation.description: Llave primaria del registro en la tabla de monitoreo en donde se colocar la informacin de avance de un proceso en ejecucin, si no se especifica, un nuevo registro ser creado y en l se actualizar la informacin.

documentation.label: Reporting Period
documentation.description: Number of milliseconds to establish a period reporting.

documentation.label: Periodo de Reporte
documentation.description: Nmero de milisegundos despus del cul se actualizar el registro de la tabla de Monitoreo.

documentation.label: Etiqueta
documentation.description: A tag to identify the process that would be running.

documentation.label: Etiqueta
documentation.description: Una etiqueta para identificar mejor el proceso que estara en ejecucin.

documentation.label: Remarks
documentation.description: This variable contains observations caught during the comparison process.

documentation.label: Query time A
documentation.description: This variable contains how long it took to the database to resolve the first result set.

documentation.label: Query time B
documentation.description: This variable contains how long it took to the database to resolve the second result set.

documentation.label: Consistency Calculation Time
documentation.description: This variable contains how long it took the EBX server to compute the consistency comparison once both source queries were resolved.

documentation.label: Deletion Time
documentation.description: This variable contains how long int took to database to process the deletion of the previous values residing within EBX results table.

documentation.label: Insertion Time
documentation.description: This variable contains how long it took to insert new record results from consistency comparison.

documentation.label: Processed Rows
documentation.description: This variable contains how many records were processed to insert in the results table.

documentation.label: Make Consistency Comparison with SQL Export
documentation.description: This task makes a consistency data quality dimension comparison between two tables (or result sets) that can be assambled by querying directly through a Data Source Definition (JNDI). It writes directly to a SQL table assuming that the specified table contains the following columns: "ID (integer), Tabla varchar(80), Llave varchar (2000), Resultado varchar (2000), Mensajes varchar (2000)" with the appropriate names (case sensitive).

documentation.label: Efectua Comparacin de Consistencia (SQL Export)
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo una comparacin de la dimensin de calidad de datos de Consistencia entre dos tablas (o conjuntos de resultado) que puedan ser obtenidos al ejecutar consultas directas a travs de la Definicin de la Fuente de Datos (JNDI). Escribe los resultados en una tabla SQL que contenga las siguientes columnas "ID (integer), Tabla varchar (80), Llave varchar (2000), Resultado varchar (2000), Mensajes varchar (2000)" con los nombres correspondientes.

documentation.label: Efectua Comparacin de Consistencia (SQL Export)
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo una comparacin de la dimensin de calidad de datos de Consistencia entre dos tablas (o conjuntos de resultado) que puedan ser obtenidos al ejecutar consultas directas a travs de la Definicin de la Fuente de Datos (JNDI). Escribe los resultados en una tabla SQL que contenga las siguientes columnas "ID (integer), Tabla varchar (80), Llave varchar (2000), Resultado varchar (2000), Mensajes varchar (2000)" con los nombres correspondientes.

documentation.label: Data Source Name
documentation.description: This is the Data Source Name as defined in the Global Naming Resource within the App Server configuration files.

documentation.label: Source Query A
documentation.description: A query to build the A-side result set to be used as the main set. Each record from this set will be matched against the B-side result set to see if there is any record matching the condition logic described by "Comparison Class Name" java class.

documentation.label: Keys A
documentation.description: The A-side (result set) primary keys (separated with comma "," and without blanks).

documentation.label: Source Query B
documentation.description: A query to build the B-side result set to be used as a search result set where each record from the A-side result set will be matched against by using the corresponding Key definitions.

documentation.label: Keys B
documentation.description: The B-side (result set) primary keys (separated with comma "," and without blanks).

documentation.label: Comparison Class Name
documentation.description: A java class name that implements "org.inspira.alldatum.jcapiz.ebx.taskbean.consistency.OnRecordsMatchComparison" interface containing the comparison logic.

documentation.label: Field Mappings
documentation.description: This specifies pairs of field values (from result set A to result set B) that will be compared as "equals". Pairs are separated with a pipe "|", and value pairs are separated with a comma ",". This is optional.

documentation.label: Is Inverse Count
documentation.description: A boolean value, ff true, then the result should be "Number of Non Compliant Records", else "Number of Compliant Records" should be taken into account.

documentation.label: Details Table Schema
documentation.description: The schema name where the details table is.

documentation.label: Details Table
documentation.description: This is the table containing the details in terms of which table is, which key values correspond to the processed table and the result or remarks produced during the comparison process.

documentation.label: Table Name
documentation.description: This is the table name to use to register every record detail for the current comparison process within the details table. This table name is just for business matters and does not have to do with any phisical table name.

documentation.label: Fetch Size
documentation.description: This is the fetch size parameter to configure the jdbc extraction process for reading records to be indexed or searched.

documentation.label: Batch Size
documentation.description: This is the batch size parameter to configure the jdbc insertion process for writing the results to the details table.

documentation.label: Remarks
documentation.description: This variable contains observations caught during the comparison process.

documentation.label: Update Summary Value from Counting Records
documentation.description: This task counts specific values from a table to know the rate against the total table records and writes it on the first specified table record under the designated field.

documentation.label: Actualiza valor resmen desde cuenta de registros
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo un conteo de registros sobre la tabla designada que cumplan con el valor especificado y escribe el resultado en el primer registro de la tabla destino bajo el campo indicado.

documentation.label: Actualiza valor resmen desde cuenta de registros
documentation.description: Esta tarea lleva a cabo un conteo de registros sobre la tabla designada que cumplan con el valor especificado y escribe el resultado en el primer registro de la tabla destino bajo el campo indicado.

documentation.label: JNDI
documentation.description: A JNDI name visible to EBX that would be used to update the percentage value for a consistency calculated result.

documentation.label: Schema
documentation.description: Target Schema where the table that holds the results of consistency comparison results resides.

documentation.label: Target Table
documentation.description: The summary table where the resulting percentage value would be writtern to.

documentation.label: Target Table Field
documentation.description: This is the field within the target table under which the resulting value will be written.

documentation.label: Source Data Space
documentation.description: Source Data Space where the details table is.

documentation.label: Source Data Set
documentation.description: Source Data Set where the details table is.

documentation.label: Source Table
documentation.description: The details table that contains the records that will be fetched to count and get the desired rate to write to the summary table.

documentation.label: Source Table Field
documentation.description: The field within the details table that should contain the desired value to know to count the record or not.

documentation.label: Value to Count
documentation.description: The value that will be used to compare each details table record source field value against.

documentation.label: Case Sensitive
documentation.description: This value determines if the underlying database uses the corresponding quote string to surround propperly object names.

documentation.label: Remarks
documentation.description: This variable contains observations caught during the comparison process.
